intro: Rudgea morichensis, commonly known as the yellow rudgea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slight pubescence. Rudgea morichensis is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks.
